Soccer fans in Japan are surprised and disappointed at the news that...
...Homare Sawa is going to retire at the end of this season.
She's been on the national team for more than 20 years.
Sawa first played for the national squad at age 15.
She went to the United States in 1999, pioneering the practice...
...of Japanese female players signing to foreign clubs.
Sawa was the team's captain in the Women's World Cup finals in Germany four years ago.
Japan won the championship with Sawa becoming the tournament's top scorer...
I did my utmost, feeling this could be my last World Cup.
So, I don't have any regrets.
